body:
Yes, I apparently miss something in the patch. Thanks for pointing out, and those should be fixed now.

I did a "commit --amend" and then "push -force". The PR get updated. Probably I shall not do that, instead push the delta. Let me know if that's the case.

Changes look good. Couple of minor nits:
* Instead of excluding .md, why not just add the ASF header?
* Do you want to have rat automatically run by mvn when you get ready to do a release?

This is great, @yonigottesman! Do the Phoenix unit tests FlappingTransactionIT.testInflightUpdateNotSeen() and testInflightDeleteNotSeen() pass with this change? You can try running them from the omid2 feature branch.

Nice work, @yonigottesman. I made a few minor comments, @ohadshacham. My main question is do the Phoenix unit tests FlappingTransactionIT.testInflightUpdateNotSeen() and testInflightDeleteNotSeen() pass with this change? You can try running them from the omid2 feature branch in Phoenix against the phoenix-integration branch in omid2 with your patch applied.
All FlappingTransactionIT tests pass and i added a test that will pass only if snapshot filtering is done in a coprocessor before user filter is called

Hi @plaflamme thanks for this.
Can you create a patch for this pr (and the other 2) and put them in their jira?
@yonigottesman Done, I've added a patch file to all three JIRA issues.
I'm not aware of the state too much of phoenix-omid is this travis error expected?

Neither am I. 

@yonigottesman, since you committed most of the latest changes, is Travis generally working on Omid, or can we ignore this ?

Im looking at travis logs and it seems build hasn't passed for a long time now.
I think you can ignore this, and on a different branch we can try to get travis working again
The checks fail, because phoenix-thirdparty snapshot is not available.
Opened https://github.com/apache/phoenix-omid/pull/62 for the same
The test failures are fixed in the pending OMID-157, I am not duplicating the fixes for that here.
LGTM
Committed to master
Committed
duplicate to #79

@stoty following is response to your comment of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OMID-188?focusedCommentId=17231962&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-17231962.

> Doesn't need the exclusion hack that we need now

done

> Can build both the HBase 1 and 2 artifacts in one pass

Not sure whether this is necessary since users normally build one of them.

> Doesn't make maven emit warnings about dynamic artifact names during build

I don't have a solution :(
This looks like a step in the right direction. but I'll need to test this with Phoenix.

>  but I'll need to test this with Phoenix.

thanks for the testing! Some artifact has postfix (hbase-x) now so it may break some dependency rules of downstream.
rebase code

Minimum changeset to get the links working.
No changes in website content otherwise.
I'm not sure what to do about the readme, especially about the coveralls integration.
@stoty Please take a look. I have rebase the code

Thanks @chia7712  
I am super busy now, so non-blocker Omid reviews from me will probably be delayed.
Maybe someone else will step up and review.

Thanks for the fix @richardantal 
Committed with some changes.

LGTM
Thanks @stoty for the quick fix

This is still not a maven setup that I am completely happy with, but it's certainly a step in the right direction.

I've rebased this on master, and successfully tested Phoenix with the simplified dependency settings.
Committed with rebase and minor changes

Let me recap what I see:

The original problem was that the old code didnt't check for a pre-existing kerberos ugi, and forced logging in with the provided credentials, even if they weren't provided.

This made Omid almost unusable in a secure environment, as every principal would have needed their own specialized client config, with principals and keytabs.

The new code fixes it by reusing existing credentials from the cache / UGI, and for good measure replaces most of the kerberos login code which the Phoenix version.

> .. but don't have the hbase client principal/keytab configuration set? If it doesnt' work, that's fine, but we should be clear about what is expected to work (e.g. on http://phoenix.apache.org/omid.html)

It's working Josh.

> SecureUserConnectionsIT in Phoenix could probably be adopted easily.

Will raise separate issue for test cases and add those.
merged the changes.
Build failure is not related to this.
Come to think of it, we may update mockito as well.

> Come to think of it, we may update mockito as well.

we can rebase to 1.10.9 Istvan. Will make the changes.
The test failures are not related to it.
Pushed to master. Thanks for review @stoty @virajjasani .
@stoty @chia7712 took some simple step of creating random number between 1050 to 20000 and use as a random port number in tests not changing any core. WDYT?

Usually this construct is used to generate a free port:

https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/01876071b990063899e0839cdda9745783fe814c/hbase-http/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/http/HttpServerFunctionalTest.java#L278

> Usually this construct is used to generate a free port:
> 
> https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/01876071b990063899e0839cdda9745783fe814c/hbase-http/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/http/HttpServerFunctionalTest.java#L278

yes in HBase or Hadoop port 0 will be used to get free port. Let me check the same way.
@stoty handled the review comment and fixed the failing test cases. Please take a look. Thanks
Closing this as we have a fix for the root cause with dynamic port allocation.

OMID has its own JIRA project.
Please clone the Phoenix ticket to OMID, and update the commit message and patch description.
Sorry, wanted to close the Phoenix one.
All done!
Can you please open an OMID JIRA for the change, and update this PR to refer to that ?

> Can you please open an OMID JIRA for the change, and update this PR to refer to that ?

Done: OMID-211
Commons IO does not support Java 7 anymore from 2.7 so this PR would break the compatibility. I'll check how this could be reworked.
This has been fixed by OMID-198
Merged from a cloned commit.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Build fails with an enforcer rule to always fail?
`[INFO] --- maven-enforcer-plugin:1.4.1:enforce (enforce) @ omid ---
[WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.AlwaysFail failed with message:
Always fails!`

The failure with hbase-1 profile is intentional, as it is no longer supported.
I'm going to update the test job.

I had to pause working on 5.2 stuff due to @dayjob deadlines, but now I can resume work on it. (Bar the usual summer PTOs)
Can you please re-review @gjacoby126  ?
We can change/drop the enforcer rules in any way you see fit, it's not an essential part of the patch.
Fixed both versions, @gjacoby126.

Thre are still some deprecation warnings:


While some of those are not HBase related, this would be a great opportunity to clean all of them up.

All unit tests passed for me locally before I pushed this up.

Phoenix itself is using mockito-core 1.x and should align with HBase, which is using 2.28.2 on branch-2.4 and branch-2.5, but this is out of scope of this change.
Yes, @apurtell , the only log4j dependencies are the test/runtime log4j2 dependencies for tests and benchmarks, examples, etc.

> Looks good. Please run a local Phoenix test with this Omid version to see if that catches any problems.

The tests ran successfully, but I got the following error message:
`[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.jacoco:jacoco-maven-plugin:0.8.7:report (report) on project phoenix-core: An error has occurred in JaCoCo report generation.: Error while creating report: Unknown block type c0. -> [Help 1] `
Note to self: fix the commit description, it's netty, not jetty
Thank you Dora for the fix
I hopefully fixed the problems you found, please check again.
Superseded by #119.
Superseded by #120.
Thank you @stoty for the review
@apurtell Can you merge this when you're back ?

I cloned @apurtell 's OMID-226 PR to rebase it on the current OMID head, and see if I could figure out why a few tests were failing. To my surprise after the rebase all tests passed for me locally -- let's see what TravisCI does.
The tests have passed locally for me, too.

@gjacoby126 Were you able to make progess on this ?
This is the only remaining issue before releasing the next version.

I still can't recreate the issue with TestWorldTimeOracle.testTimestampOraclePanicsWhenTheStorageHasProblems locally, and the code looks fine. I reordered the mock setup to be before component initialization in case there was a race condition. In addition, the extra thread calling next() on the oracle didn't seem necessary so I removed it, which sped up the test. 

Let's see again if that improves things in TravisCI.
@stoty - looks like it's passing now.
I can see a test error, but that was already present earlier.
Thanks @stoty for the review!

@gjacoby126  Thank you for your suggestions! :)  
We are planning these upgrades in the other components as well. There's already an open PR in HBase and in Hadoop for this change (see: https://github.com/apache/hbase/pull/5013 and https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/5345).
Can you please fix the above conflicts reported by github ?
Thanks @stoty for the review!
Closing this and will go with https://github.com/apache/phoenix-omid/pull/136 instead
Thank you Ankit for the review.

Thank you Istvan for the review
tests are OK apart from a known flaky one.
Fixed JIRA ID

Tested by first introducing as license error by deleting header from one of existing java file and then running `mvn license:check` both with/without change. Build failed in both cases as expected.

Tested by first introducing a license error by deleting header from one of existing java file and then running mvn license:check both with/without change, failing as expected.

Next ran mvn license:format to fix header issue.

> Can you make a follow-up ticket to really clean up the configuration ?

Sure let me clean up with a follow up JIRA. 

Also do you think we should replace this with spotless? I am well versed with it and based on what I am seeing this plugin is only for headers, which spotless does seemlessly. 

I am okay just cleaning up as well. Let me know what do you think.

I don't know spotless well.
Lets do whatever HBase is doing.

> I don't know spotless well.
> Lets do whatever HBase is doing.

HBase uses spotless. Let me create a jira to move to spotless and clean up.
Bumped up the netty to latest 4.1.100.Final. This change is not required.
